meanings.definition: The ability to be stained or marked.
meanings.sent1: The white shirt's stainability was poor, as it got marked easily.
meanings.sent2: The fabric's stainability was tested by spilling coffee on it.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the couch's low stainability amusing, leaving paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The paper's stainability was like a sponge, absorbing ink instantly.
meanings.sent5: The carpet's poor stainability made every spill a disaster.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to resist staining or marking.
meanings.sent1: The new table's stainability was impressive, repelling any spills.
meanings.sent2: The stainability of the kitchen counter made cleaning up spills a breeze.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape had incredible stainability, never showing any dirt.
meanings.sent4: The armor's stainability was like a shield, protecting it from any marks.
meanings.sent5: The jacket's high stainability kept it looking new even after many wears.

meanings.definition: The act of staining or marking something.
meanings.sent1: The child's stainability of the walls with crayons led to colorful artwork.
meanings.sent2: The accidental stainability of the carpet with red wine caused panic.
meanings.sent3: The artist's stainability of the canvas with paint created a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist's stainability of the wall with spray paint caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The chef's stainability of the cutting board with beet juice left a vibrant mark.
